question_text: A triangular pyramid (tetrahedron) is placed on a table with one face flat against the surface. If you look at it from directly above, what shape will you see?
solution:
• A tetrahedron has 4 triangular faces
• When one triangular face lies flat on the table, the three other faces meet at a point above
• Looking from directly above, you see the outline formed by the three bottom edges of the pyramid
• These three edges form the perimeter of the triangular base
• Therefore, the answer is B because the view from above shows a triangular shape

visual_data.description: A triangular pyramid (tetrahedron) resting on one face on a flat surface, with viewing perspective from directly above

curriculum_source: NSW Selective Entry (Year 7 Entry) - Thinking Skills - Spatial Reasoning

answer_verification.reasoning: A tetrahedron has 4 equilateral (or at least triangular) faces. When placed with one face flat on a table, that triangular base is the only face in contact with the surface. Looking directly from above, the viewer sees the outline of this triangular base face, which is a triangle. The three other faces slope upward to meet at an apex point, which is directly above the interior of the base triangle and thus hidden from the top view. Options A (circle), C (square), D (hexagon), and E (rectangle) are geometrically impossible as top-down projections of a tetrahedron in this orientation.

question_text:
The table shows the number of visitors to a museum over four days:

Day       | Visitors
Monday    | 145
Tuesday   | 178
Wednesday | 162
Thursday  | 195

How many visitors came to the museum on Tuesday and Wednesday combined?
solution:
• Find the number of visitors on Tuesday: 178
• Find the number of visitors on Wednesday: 162
• Add these two values: 178 + 162 = 340
• Therefore, the answer is B because 340 visitors came to the museum on Tuesday and Wednesday combined.

question_text: A cylindrical water tank has a radius of 3 metres and a height of 5 metres. What is the volume of water the tank can hold when completely full? (Use π = 3.14)
solution:
• Volume of cylinder = π × r² × h
• Volume = 3.14 × 3² × 5
• Volume = 3.14 × 9 × 5
• Volume = 3.14 × 45 = 141.3 m³
• Therefore, the answer is C because the tank can hold 141.3 cubic metres of water when completely full

visual_data.description: A simple 3D diagram of a cylindrical water tank shown in perspective view with labels indicating radius = 3 m and height = 5 m

question_text: A drone's battery level is displayed on a power indicator from 0 to 3 units. The drone starts a flight at 2 and 1/4 units. After flying, the battery drops to 5/6 units. The drone then recharges to exactly halfway between its starting level and its lowest level. What is the battery level after recharging?
solution:
• Starting level: 2 and 1/4 = 9/4 units
• Lowest level: 5/6 units
• Find halfway point: (9/4 + 5/6) ÷ 2
• Convert to common denominator: 9/4 = 27/12 and 5/6 = 10/12
• Sum: 27/12 + 10/12 = 37/12
• Halfway: 37/12 ÷ 2 = 37/24 = 1 and 13/24 units
• Therefore, the answer is B because the battery level after recharging to the halfway point is 1 and 13/24 units

visual_data.description: A horizontal number line from 0 to 3 units marked with major divisions at 0, 1, 2, and 3. Three points are marked: starting position at 2 and 1/4, lowest position at 5/6, and final recharged position at 1 and 13/24. The number line should be labeled 'Battery Level (units)'.

question_text: A thermometer measures the temperature of a science experiment on a scale from 0°C to 1°C. At the start, the temperature reads 1/4°C. What temperature is shown on the thermometer?
solution:
• The thermometer shows 1/4°C at the start
• Converting 1/4 to decimal: 1 ÷ 4 = 0.25
• Therefore, the answer is A because 1/4°C equals 0.25°C

question_text: A solar panel's energy output is displayed on a meter from 0 to 5 units. In the morning, the output is at 1 and 2/5 units. By midday, the output increases to 3 and 4/5 units. What is the increase in energy output?
solution:
• Convert mixed numbers to improper fractions: Morning = 1 and 2/5 = 7/5 units, Midday = 3 and 4/5 = 19/5 units
• Calculate the difference: 19/5 - 7/5 = 12/5 units
• Convert back to mixed number: 12/5 = 2 and 2/5 units
• Therefore, the answer is B because the increase in energy output is 2 and 2/5 units

visual_data.description: A horizontal number line marked from 0 to 5 units with major tick marks at each whole number. Two points are marked: one at 1 and 2/5 labeled 'Morning' and another at 3 and 4/5 labeled 'Midday'. The segment between these two points should be highlighted to show the distance being measured.

question_text: A pentagon is a polygon with 5 sides. How many vertices (corners) does a pentagon have?
solution:
• A vertex is a corner point where two sides of a polygon meet
• A pentagon has 5 sides
• Each side connects to the next side at a vertex, creating 5 vertices in total
• Therefore, the answer is B because a pentagon has 5 vertices

question_text: A rectangular garden path is 12 metres long and 3 metres wide. A gardener wants to create a border of uniform width around the entire path using decorative tiles. If the total area including the border is 80 square metres, what is the width of the border in metres?
solution:
• Original path area = 12 × 3 = 36 m²
• Let the border width be x metres
• The new dimensions including border are: length = (12 + 2x) and width = (3 + 2x)
• Total area equation: (12 + 2x)(3 + 2x) = 80
• Expanding: 36 + 24x + 6x + 4x² = 80
• Simplifying: 4x² + 30x + 36 = 80
• Therefore: 4x² + 30x - 44 = 0
• Dividing by 2: 2x² + 15x - 22 = 0
• Factoring: (2x - 2)(x + 11) = 0 or using quadratic formula
• Since x must be positive: 2x - 2 = 0, so x = 1
• Therefore, the answer is B because the border width is 1 metre

question_text: A triangular flag has angles measuring 65°, 45°, and x°. What is the value of x?
solution:
• The sum of all angles in any triangle equals 180°
• We have: 65° + 45° + x° = 180°
• Simplifying: 110° + x° = 180°
• Solving for x: x° = 180° - 110° = 70°
• Therefore, the answer is B because the missing angle must be 70° to make the angle sum equal to 180°

question_text: A regular hexagon is divided into triangles by drawing lines from its centre to each vertex. What is the size of each angle at the centre of the hexagon?
solution:
• A regular hexagon has 6 equal sides and 6 vertices
• Drawing lines from the centre to each vertex creates 6 identical triangles
• The angles at the centre form a complete rotation around a point, which equals 360°
• Each central angle = 360° ÷ 6 = 60°
• Therefore, the answer is B because each angle at the centre measures 60°

question_text: A pizza is cut into 8 equal slices. What is the angle at the centre of each slice?
solution:
• A full circle has 360° at the centre
• The pizza is divided into 8 equal slices
• Each slice has an angle of 360° ÷ 8 = 45°
• Therefore, the answer is B because each slice has a central angle of 45°

question_text: A clock shows 3:00. What is the angle between the hour hand and the minute hand?
solution:
• At 3:00, the minute hand points at 12 and the hour hand points at 3
• A clock is divided into 12 hours, so each hour represents 360° ÷ 12 = 30°
• From 12 to 3 is 3 hours, so the angle is 3 × 30° = 90°
• Therefore, the answer is B because the angle between the hands is 90°

question_text: Look at the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern where the third number equals the first number plus the second number.
• Row 1: 3 + 9 = 12 ✓
• Row 2: 5 + 10 = 15 ✓
• Row 3: 8 + 16 = ?
• 8 + 16 = 24
• Therefore, the answer is C because the missing number is 24.

question_text: A parallelogram-shaped skateboard ramp has one angle measuring 55°. What is the measure of the adjacent angle?
solution:
• In a parallelogram, adjacent angles are supplementary (they add up to 180°)
• If one angle is 55°, then the adjacent angle = 180° - 55° = 125°
• Therefore, the answer is B because adjacent angles in a parallelogram sum to 180°

question_text: A library records the number of books borrowed over three weeks. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each column follows a pattern where numbers increase by adding a fixed amount
• Column 1: 8, 12, 16 (adding 4 each time)
• Column 2: 15, 18, 21 (adding 3 each time)
• Column 3: 18, ?, 36 (adding 9 each time)
• Therefore, the answer is B because 18 + 9 = 27, and 27 + 9 = 36

question_text:
The table shows the number of books read by five students during summer vacation:

Alex: 8 books
Bella: 12 books
Chen: 6 books
Dani: 10 books
Emma: 9 books

What is the range of books read by these students?
solution:
• Range = highest value - lowest value
• Highest number of books read = 12 (Bella)
• Lowest number of books read = 6 (Chen)
• Range = 12 - 6 = 6
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is 6 books

question_text: A farmer plants trees in three different orchards. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row shows a number multiplied by 1, 2, and 3
• Row 1: 3×1=3, 3×2=6, 3×3=9
• Row 2: 5×1=5, 5×2=10, 5×3=15
• Row 3: 8×1=8, 8×2=16, 8×3=24
• Therefore, the answer is C because 8×3=24

question_text:
The bar graph shows the daily temperature (in °C) recorded in a city over one week. On how many days was the temperature above the mean temperature for the week?

Monday: 18°C, Tuesday: 22°C, Wednesday: 20°C, Thursday: 25°C, Friday: 19°C, Saturday: 24°C, Sunday: 20°C
solution:
• First, calculate the mean temperature: (18 + 22 + 20 + 25 + 19 + 24 + 20) ÷ 7 = 148 ÷ 7 = 21.14°C (approximately)
• Count days above 21.14°C: Tuesday (22°C), Thursday (25°C), and Saturday (24°C)
• Therefore, the answer is B because 3 days had temperatures above the mean

question_text: A marine biologist counts dolphins spotted during three observation sessions. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern: first number × 2, then × 3, then × 4
• Row 1: 3×2=6, 3×3=9, 3×4=12
• Row 2: 4×2=8, 4×3=12, 4×4=16
• Row 3: 5×2=10, 5×3=15, 5×4=20
• Therefore, the answer is B because 5×4=20

question_text:
The table shows the number of goals scored by a soccer team in their last 7 matches:

Match 1: 3 goals
Match 2: 1 goal
Match 3: 4 goals
Match 4: 2 goals
Match 5: 3 goals
Match 6: 5 goals
Match 7: 3 goals

What is the median number of goals scored?
solution:
• To find the median, arrange the data in order from smallest to largest: 1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 5
• With 7 values (odd number), the median is the middle value, which is the 4th value
• The 4th value in the ordered list is 3
• Therefore, the answer is B because the median number of goals scored is 3

question_text:
The table shows the number of eggs collected from a chicken farm over 5 days:

Day | Eggs Collected
Monday | 24
Tuesday | 30
Wednesday | 27
Thursday | 30
Friday | 19

What is the mode of the number of eggs collected?
solution:
• The mode is the value that appears most frequently in a data set
• Looking at the data: 24 appears once, 30 appears twice, 27 appears once, 19 appears once
• 30 appears more frequently than any other value (it appears 2 times)
• Therefore, the answer is D because the mode is 30

question_text: A museum curator organizes ancient coins into display cases. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each number in the third column is calculated by multiplying the sum of the first two numbers in that row by 3
• Row 1: (4 + 8) × 3 = 12 × 3 = 36
• Row 2: (6 + 7) × 3 = 13 × 3 = 39
• Row 3: (9 + 9) × 3 = 18 × 3 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is D because the pattern requires adding the first two numbers and multiplying by 3

question_text:
The table shows the number of visitors to a museum over 6 days:

Monday: 45 visitors
Tuesday: 52 visitors
Wednesday: 38 visitors
Thursday: 61 visitors
Friday: 54 visitors
Saturday: 70 visitors

What is the range of visitors across these 6 days?
solution:
• Range = highest value - lowest value
• Highest number of visitors = 70 (Saturday)
• Lowest number of visitors = 38 (Wednesday)
• Range = 70 - 38 = 32
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of visitors is 32

question_text: A sports coach records the number of laps completed by three swimmers during training. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern: first number × 1, first number × 2, first number × 3
• Row 1: 5×1=5, 5×2=10, 5×3=15
• Row 2: 7×1=7, 7×2=14, 7×3=21
• Row 3: 6×1=6, 6×2=12, 6×3=?
• Therefore, the answer is B because 6×3=18

question_text:
The table shows the number of medals won by five countries at a sports competition:

Country A: 18 medals
Country B: 25 medals
Country C: 14 medals
Country D: 22 medals
Country E: 16 medals

What is the range of medals won?
solution:
• The range is found by subtracting the smallest value from the largest value
• Identify the highest number of medals: 25 (Country B)
• Identify the lowest number of medals: 14 (Country C)
• Range = 25 - 14 = 11
• Therefore, the answer is A because the range of medals won is 11

question_text: A weather station records temperature readings at three different times of day. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Look at the diagonal pattern from top-left to bottom-right: The sum of each diagonal is constant.
• Top-left to bottom-right diagonal: 8 + 12 + 16 = 36
• Check the other complete diagonal (top-right to bottom-left): 18 + 12 + 6 = 36
• For the middle row diagonal through the ?: 10 + 12 + ? must equal 36
• Therefore, ? = 36 - 10 - 12 = 14... This approach is incorrect.
• Alternative pattern: Each row follows the rule that the third number equals the sum of the first number and twice the second number.
• Row 1: 8 + (2 × 12) = 8 + 24 = 32... This doesn't match 18.
• Correct pattern: The sum of the first and third numbers in each row equals twice the middle number.
• Row 1: 8 + 18 = 26, and 2 × 12 = 24... This doesn't work either.
• Actual pattern: In each row, the middle number is the average of the first and third numbers.
• Row 1: (8 + 18) ÷ 2 = 26 ÷ 2 = 13... This doesn't match 12.
• Correct pattern: Each column follows a pattern where the third number equals the sum of the first two numbers minus 2.
• Column 1: 8 + 10 - 2 = 16 ✓
• Column 2: 12 + 14 - 2 = 24 ✓
• Column 3: 18 + ? must give 40, so 18 + ? - 2 = 40, meaning ? = 24... checking: 18 + 6 - 2 = 22
• Correct pattern: In each column, the third number equals the difference between the second and first numbers, multiplied by 2, then added to the first number.
• Column 1: 8 + 2(10-8) = 8 + 4 = 12... No, the third is 16.
• Actual pattern: The third number in each column equals the sum of the first two numbers minus a value.
• Column 1: 8 + 10 - 2 = 16 ✓
• Column 2: 12 + 14 - 2 = 24 ✓
• Column 3: 18 + 6 - 2 = 22
• Therefore, the answer is C because following the column pattern, 18 + 6 - 2 = 22.

question_text:
A library recorded the number of people who borrowed books each day for 5 days:

Monday: 32 people
Tuesday: 28 people
Wednesday: 35 people
Thursday: 28 people
Friday: 42 people

What is the range of the number of people who borrowed books?
solution:
• Range = highest value - lowest value
• Highest value = 42 (Friday)
• Lowest value = 28 (Tuesday and Thursday)
• Range = 42 - 28 = 14
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is 14

question_text: A photographer organizes photos into albums. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern where the first number is multiplied by 3, 6, and 9 to get the three values
• Row 1: 2×3=6, 2×6=12, 2×9=18
• Row 2: 3×3=9, 3×6=18, 3×9=27
• Row 3: 4×3=12, 4×6=24, 4×9=36
• The missing value is in Row 2, third position: 3×9=27
• Therefore, the answer is B because 27 completes the multiplication pattern

question_text: A music teacher tracks the number of practice hours completed by three students over three months. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern: first number × 1, first number × 2, first number × 3
• Row 1: 5×1=5, 5×2=10, 5×3=15
• Row 2: 6×1=6, 6×2=12, 6×3=18
• Row 3: 7×1=7, 7×2=14, 7×3=21
• Therefore, the answer is C because 7×3=21

question_text: A scientist studies the growth of three different plant species over time. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Looking at the pattern across rows and columns: each number in the third column equals the sum of the first two numbers in that row, multiplied by the row number.
• Row 1: (4 + 5) × 1 = 9 × 1 = 9
• Row 2: (6 + 3) × 2 = 9 × 2 = 18
• Row 3: (7 + 11) × 3 = 18 × 3 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is B because 54 is the result of applying the pattern (7 + 11) × 3.

question_text: A hexagonal tile has its vertices labeled clockwise from the top as A, B, C, D, E, and F. If the tile is reflected across a vertical line through its center, which vertex will be in the position where vertex B was originally?
solution:
• In a regular hexagon with vertices labeled clockwise A (top), B (top-right), C (bottom-right), D (bottom), E (bottom-left), F (top-left)
• A vertical reflection through the center swaps left and right sides
• Vertex B (top-right) reflects to the top-left position
• The vertex originally at top-left is vertex F
• Therefore, the answer is B because vertex F will now occupy the position where B was originally

question_text:
The table shows the number of goals scored by five soccer players during a tournament:

Player   | Goals Scored
Emma     | 7
Finn     | 5
Grace    | 9
Henry    | 6
Isla     | 8

What fraction of the total goals were scored by Grace?
solution:
• First, calculate the total number of goals: 7 + 5 + 9 + 6 + 8 = 35 goals
• Grace scored 9 goals out of the total 35 goals
• The fraction is 9/35, which cannot be simplified further
• Therefore, the answer is C because Grace scored 9/35 of the total goals

question_text: A regular pentagon has all its diagonals drawn from one vertex. How many triangles are formed inside the pentagon?
solution:
• A regular pentagon has 5 vertices
• From one vertex, you can draw diagonals to all non-adjacent vertices
• You cannot draw to itself or to the 2 adjacent vertices (these would be sides, not diagonals)
• So from one vertex, you can draw 5 - 3 = 2 diagonals
• These 2 diagonals divide the pentagon into 3 triangles
• Therefore, the answer is B because drawing all diagonals from one vertex creates 3 triangles

question_text: A trapezoid-shaped window has parallel sides of length 8 metres and 12 metres. The perpendicular distance between these parallel sides is 5 metres. What is the area of the window?
solution:
• The area of a trapezoid is calculated using the formula: Area = ½ × (sum of parallel sides) × height
• Sum of parallel sides = 8 + 12 = 20 metres
• Area = ½ × 20 × 5 = 10 × 5 = 50 square metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the area of the trapezoid-shaped window is 50 square metres

question_text: A rhombus-shaped kite has one interior angle measuring 120°. What is the measure of the smallest angle in the rhombus?
solution:
• In a rhombus, opposite angles are equal and adjacent angles are supplementary (sum to 180°)
• If one angle is 120°, then the adjacent angle = 180° - 120° = 60°
• The four angles are: 120°, 60°, 120°, 60°
• Therefore, the answer is B because the smallest angle measures 60°

question_text: A circular trampoline has a diameter of 4 metres. What is the radius of the trampoline?
solution:
• The radius of a circle is half of its diameter
• Radius = Diameter ÷ 2
• Radius = 4 ÷ 2 = 2 metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the radius is half the diameter

question_text: A cube-shaped gift box has edges that are each 6cm long. How many faces does the cube have?
solution:
• A cube is a three-dimensional shape with square faces
• By definition, a cube has 6 faces (top, bottom, front, back, left, right)
• The length of the edges does not change the number of faces
• Therefore, the answer is B because a cube always has 6 faces

question_text: A jeweler organizes gemstones into storage boxes. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern where the first number is multiplied by 2, 4, and 6 to get the three values
• Row 1: 3×2=6, 3×4=12, 3×6=18
• Row 2: 4×2=8, 4×4=16, 4×6=24
• Row 3: 5×2=10, 5×4=?, 5×6=30
• Therefore, the answer is B because 5×4=20

question_text: A rectangular soccer field has a length of 100 metres and a width of 60 metres. A player runs diagonally from one corner to the opposite corner. Approximately how far does the player run?
solution:
• The diagonal of a rectangle forms a right-angled triangle with the length and width
• Using Pythagoras' theorem: diagonal² = length² + width²
• diagonal² = 100² + 60² = 10000 + 3600 = 13600
• diagonal = √13600 ≈ 116.6 metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the player runs approximately 117 metres

question_text: A theatre manager records ticket sales for three different shows. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Looking at the columns: In each column, the third number equals the sum of the first two numbers multiplied by 3.
• Column 1: (8 + 4) × 3 = 12 × 3 = 36
• Column 2: (7 + 5) × 3 = 12 × 3 = 36
• Column 3: (9 + 9) × 3 = 18 × 3 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is B because the missing value is 54.

question_text: A regular octagon (8-sided polygon) has all its interior angles equal. What is the measure of each interior angle?
solution:
• The sum of interior angles in any polygon is (n - 2) × 180°, where n is the number of sides
• For an octagon, n = 8, so the sum = (8 - 2) × 180° = 6 × 180° = 1080°
• Since the octagon is regular, all angles are equal, so each angle = 1080° ÷ 8 = 135°
• Therefore, the answer is B because each interior angle of a regular octagon measures 135°

• Row 2: 7×1=7, 7×2=14, 7×3=21

question_text: A triangular sail on a boat has a base of 8 metres and a height of 5 metres. What is the area of the sail?
solution:
• The area of a triangle is calculated using the formula: Area = ½ × base × height
• Substituting the values: Area = ½ × 8 × 5
• Area = ½ × 40 = 20 square metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the area of the triangular sail is 20 square metres

question_text: A postal worker sorts letters into delivery routes. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern of multiplying the first number by 1, 2, and 3
• Row 1: 6×1=6, 6×2=12, 6×3=18
• Row 2: 7×1=7, 7×2=14, 7×3=21
• Row 3: 8×1=8, 8×2=16, 8×3=24
• Therefore, the answer is B because 8×3=24

question_text: A square tile has a perimeter of 32 centimetres. What is the length of one side of the tile?
solution:
• A square has 4 equal sides
• Perimeter = 4 × side length
• 32 = 4 × side length
• Side length = 32 ÷ 4 = 8cm
• Therefore, the answer is B because each side of the square tile is 8 centimetres long

question_text: A chess club records the number of tournaments won by three players across different age groups. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Look at the pattern in each column: the third number equals the first number multiplied by the second number, then divided by 2
• Column 1: (8 × 3) ÷ 2 = 24 ÷ 2 = 12
• Column 2: (10 × 4) ÷ 2 = 40 ÷ 2 = 20
• Column 3: (12 × 9) ÷ 2 = 108 ÷ 2 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is B because 54 completes the pattern

question_text:
A pet shop recorded the number of fish sold each day for one week:

Monday: 15 fish
Tuesday: 22 fish
Wednesday: 18 fish
Thursday: 25 fish
Friday: 20 fish
Saturday: 30 fish
Sunday: 12 fish

What is the range of fish sold during this week?
solution:
• Range = highest value − lowest value
• Highest number of fish sold = 30 (Saturday)
• Lowest number of fish sold = 12 (Sunday)
• Range = 30 − 12 = 18
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is 18 fish

question_text:
A bakery recorded the number of loaves of bread sold each day for 5 days:

Monday: 42 loaves
Tuesday: 38 loaves
Wednesday: 50 loaves
Thursday: 38 loaves
Friday: 52 loaves

What is the mode of the number of loaves sold?
solution:
• The mode is the value that appears most frequently in the data set
• Looking at the data: 42, 38, 50, 38, 52
• The number 38 appears twice (Tuesday and Thursday)
• All other values (42, 50, 52) appear only once
• Therefore, the answer is B because 38 is the most frequent value (the mode)

question_text: A mechanic records the number of car parts replaced during three service appointments. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern: first number × 2, × 4, × 5
• Row 1: 3×2=6, 3×4=12, 3×5=15
• Row 2: 2×2=4, 2×4=8, 2×5=10
• Row 3: 4×2=8, 4×4=16, 4×5=20
• Therefore, the answer is B because 4×5=20

question_text:
A gaming store recorded the number of video games sold each day for one week:

Monday: 34 games
Tuesday: 28 games
Wednesday: 41 games
Thursday: 35 games
Friday: 52 games
Saturday: 46 games
Sunday: 36 games

What is the range of the number of games sold during the week?
solution:
• Range = highest value − lowest value
• Highest number of games sold = 52 (Friday)
• Lowest number of games sold = 28 (Tuesday)
• Range = 52 − 28 = 24
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is the difference between the maximum and minimum values

question_text: A librarian organizes books returned each week. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• The pattern works by adding the first two numbers in each row, then multiplying the sum by 3 to get the third number.
• Row 1: (4 + 2) × 3 = 6 × 3 = 18
• Row 2: (5 + 3) × 3 = 8 × 3 = 24
• Row 3: (7 + 11) × 3 = 18 × 3 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is B because 54 is the result of adding 7 and 11, then multiplying by 3.

question_text:
The table shows the number of points scored by a basketball player in 9 games:

Game 1: 18 points
Game 2: 24 points
Game 3: 15 points
Game 4: 22 points
Game 5: 18 points
Game 6: 30 points
Game 7: 18 points
Game 8: 26 points
Game 9: 21 points

What is the difference between the mode and the median of these scores?
solution:
• First, arrange the scores in order: 15, 18, 18, 18, 21, 22, 24, 26, 30
• The mode is the most frequently occurring value: 18 appears 3 times, which is more than any other value, so mode = 18
• The median is the middle value: with 9 numbers, the middle value is the 5th number = 21
• The difference between mode and median = 21 - 18 = 3
• Therefore, the answer is B because the difference is 3 points

question_text:
A plant nursery tracks the number of seedlings planted in different garden beds during spring. The table shows the planting data:

| Garden Bed | Monday | Tuesday | Wednesday | Thursday |
|------------|--------|---------|-----------|----------|
| Vegetables | 45     | 38      | 52        | 41       |
| Flowers    | 32     | 29      | 35        | 38       |
| Herbs      | 18     | 22      | 19        | 25       |

How many seedlings in total were planted on Tuesday and Wednesday combined?
solution:
• Tuesday total: 38 + 29 + 22 = 89 seedlings
• Wednesday total: 52 + 35 + 19 = 106 seedlings
• Combined total: 89 + 106 = 215 seedlings
• Therefore, the answer is C because 215 seedlings were planted on Tuesday and Wednesday combined.

question_text: A bar graph shows the number of points scored by seven basketball players in a championship game: 12, 18, 15, 12, 22, 12, 19. The coach wants to find the median number of points scored. What is the median?
solution:
• First, arrange the scores in ascending order: 12, 12, 12, 15, 18, 19, 22
• With 7 values, the median is the 4th value (middle position)
• The 4th value in the ordered list is 15
• Therefore, the answer is B because the median is 15 points

question_text:
A robotics club tracks the battery usage of different robots during practice sessions. The table shows the battery consumption:

| Robot Type | Base Usage (%) | Per Minute (%) |
|------------|----------------|----------------|
| Explorer   | 5              | 2              |
| Builder    | 8              | 1.5            |
| Racer      | 10             | 3              |
| Helper     | 3              | 1              |

Sarah runs an Explorer robot for 12 minutes and a Helper robot for 15 minutes. What is the total battery usage for both robots?
solution:
• Explorer robot: Base usage = 5%, Per minute usage = 2% × 12 = 24%. Total = 5% + 24% = 29%
• Helper robot: Base usage = 3%, Per minute usage = 1% × 15 = 15%. Total = 3% + 15% = 18%
• Combined total battery usage = 29% + 18% = 51%
• Therefore, the answer is C because the total battery consumption for both robots is 51%

question_text: A farmer plants seeds in different sections of a garden. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern: first number × 2, then first number × 4
• Row 1: 3×2=6, 3×4=12
• Row 2: 4×2=8, 4×4=16
• Row 3: 5×2=10, 5×4=20
• Therefore, the answer is B because 5×4=20

• Row 2: 5×1=5, 5×2=10, 5×3=15

• Therefore, the answer is B because 6×3=18

answer_verification.reasoning: The pattern is clearly established: each row multiplies the first number by 1, 2, and 3 respectively. Row 3 starts with 6, so 6×3=18 is correct. All other options (15, 20, 21, 24) don't fit this consistent pattern. The solution logic is sound and verifiable.

question_text: A park ranger counts the number of birds spotted at three different observation points. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern: first number × 1, first number × 2, first number × 3
• Row 1: 5 × 1 = 5, 5 × 2 = 10, 5 × 3 = 15
• Row 2: 6 × 1 = 6, 6 × 2 = 12, 6 × 3 = 18
• Row 3: 8 × 1 = 8, 8 × 2 = 16, 8 × 3 = 24
• Therefore, the answer is B because 8 × 3 = 24

question_text: A robotics engineer tests the battery life of three different robots. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Look at the pattern in each column: the third number is the product of the first two numbers, then add the first number
• Column 1: (4 × 3) + 4 = 12 + 4 = 16
• Column 2: (5 × 4) + 5 = 20 + 5 = 25
• Column 3: (8 × 6) + 8 = 48 + 8 = 56
• Therefore, the answer is B because 56 completes the pattern

question_text: A sports coach records the number of laps completed by three swimmers during training sessions. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row shows a number multiplied by 1, 2, and 3
• Row 1: 3×1=3, 3×2=6, 3×3=9
• Row 2: 5×1=5, 5×2=10, 5×3=15
• Row 3: 6×1=6, 6×2=12, 6×3=18
• Therefore, the answer is B because 6×3=18

question_text: A rectangular smartphone screen has a length of 15 cm and a width of 8 cm. A protective film is placed diagonally across the screen from one corner to the opposite corner. What is the length of this diagonal? (Use the Pythagorean theorem: a² + b² = c²)
solution:
• Using the Pythagorean theorem where a = 15 cm and b = 8 cm
• Calculate: 15² + 8² = c²
• 225 + 64 = c²
• 289 = c²
• c = √289 = 17 cm
• Therefore, the answer is B because the diagonal measures 17 cm

question_text: A weather station records temperature readings across three different monitoring stations. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Looking at the columns, each column follows the pattern where the third number equals the sum of the first two numbers multiplied by 3.
• Column 1: (4 + 2) × 3 = 6 × 3 = 18
• Column 2: (5 + 3) × 3 = 8 × 3 = 24
• Column 3: (7 + 7) × 3 = 14 × 3 = 42
• Therefore, the answer is B because the missing value is 42.

question_text: A rectangular garden bed has a length of 12 metres and a width of 7 metres. What is the perimeter of the garden bed?
solution:
• Perimeter of a rectangle = 2 × (length + width)
• Perimeter = 2 × (12 + 7)
• Perimeter = 2 × 19 = 38 metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the perimeter is calculated by adding both lengths and both widths together.

question_text: A rectangular flag is folded in half along its diagonal, creating two congruent triangles. If the flag has a length of 18 cm and a width of 12 cm, what is the area of one of the triangular halves?
solution:
• First, calculate the area of the rectangular flag: Area = length × width = 18 × 12 = 216 cm²
• When folded along the diagonal, the rectangle is divided into two congruent triangles
• Each triangle has half the area of the rectangle: 216 ÷ 2 = 108 cm²
• Therefore, the answer is B because each triangular half has an area of 108 cm²

question_text: A hexagon is a polygon with 6 sides. How many vertices (corners) does a hexagon have?
solution:
• A vertex is a corner point where two sides of a polygon meet
• In any polygon, the number of vertices equals the number of sides
• Since a hexagon has 6 sides, it must have 6 vertices
• Therefore, the answer is B because a hexagon has 6 vertices

question_text: A florist arranges roses in bouquets for three different events. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern where the first number is multiplied by 1, 2, and 3
• Row 1: 8×1=8, 8×2=16, 8×3=24
• Row 2: 9×1=9, 9×2=18, 9×3=27
• Row 3: 10×1=10, 10×2=20, so 10×3=30 should be in the third position
• The missing value is in Row 2, Column 3: 9×3=27
• Therefore, the answer is B because 27 completes the multiplication pattern for Row 2

question_text: A triangular pizza slice has three angles. Two of the angles measure 70° and 60°. What is the measure of the third angle?
solution:
• The sum of all angles in any triangle is always 180°
• Two angles measure 70° and 60°, so their sum is 70° + 60° = 130°
• The third angle = 180° - 130° = 50°
• Therefore, the answer is B because the third angle must be 50°

question_text: A pentagonal home plate in baseball has five sides. Three of its interior angles each measure 90°, and the other two angles are equal to each other. What is the measure of each of the two equal angles?
solution:
• The sum of interior angles in a pentagon is (5-2) × 180° = 3 × 180° = 540°
• Three angles measure 90° each, so their total is 3 × 90° = 270°
• The remaining two equal angles must sum to 540° - 270° = 270°
• Each of the two equal angles measures 270° ÷ 2 = 135°
• Therefore, the answer is B because each of the two equal angles measures 135°

question_text: A triangular park has a perimeter of 48 metres. Two of its sides are equal in length, each measuring 15 metres. If the area of the park is 108 square metres, what is the height of the triangle when the third side is taken as the base?
solution:
• First, find the length of the third side (base): Perimeter = 48m, so base = 48 - 15 - 15 = 18 metres
• Use the area formula for triangles: Area = ½ × base × height
• Substitute known values: 108 = ½ × 18 × height
• Simplify: 108 = 9 × height
• Solve for height: height = 108 ÷ 9 = 12 metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the height of the triangle is 12 metres

visual_data.description: An isosceles triangle with two equal sides labeled 15m each, and a base. A dashed line from the apex perpendicular to the base represents the height (marked with h). The base is labeled 18m.

question_text:
A robotics team recorded the time (in seconds) each robot took to complete an obstacle course:

Robot A: 45 seconds
Robot B: 52 seconds
Robot C: 38 seconds
Robot D: 45 seconds
Robot E: 60 seconds
Robot F: 41 seconds

What is the range of these completion times?
solution:
• The range is calculated by subtracting the smallest value from the largest value
• Identify the largest time: 60 seconds (Robot E)
• Identify the smallest time: 38 seconds (Robot C)
• Range = 60 - 38 = 22 seconds
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of completion times is 22 seconds

question_text:
A school orchestra recorded the number of instruments played by students in different sections:

Strings: 15 instruments
Woodwinds: 8 instruments
Brass: 12 instruments
Percussion: 5 instruments

What is the range of the number of instruments across all sections?
solution:
• The range is calculated by subtracting the smallest value from the largest value
• The largest number of instruments is 15 (Strings)
• The smallest number of instruments is 5 (Percussion)
• Range = 15 - 5 = 10
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is 10

question_text:
A fruit stall recorded the number of apples sold each day for 5 days:

Monday: 56 apples
Tuesday: 48 apples
Wednesday: 62 apples
Thursday: 45 apples
Friday: 64 apples

What is the median number of apples sold?
solution:
• First, arrange the data in order from smallest to largest: 45, 48, 56, 62, 64
• The median is the middle value when data is ordered
• Since there are 5 values, the middle value is the 3rd number
• Therefore, the answer is B because the median is 56 apples

question_text:
A bookshop recorded the number of books sold each day for 7 days:

Monday: 42 books
Tuesday: 35 books
Wednesday: 48 books
Thursday: 35 books
Friday: 56 books
Saturday: 63 books
Sunday: 35 books

What is the range of the number of books sold?
solution:
• Range = highest value - lowest value
• Highest number of books sold = 63 (Saturday)
• Lowest number of books sold = 35 (Tuesday, Thursday, and Sunday)
• Range = 63 - 35 = 28
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is 28 books

question_text:
A bar graph shows the number of goals scored by five football teams during a season:

Team Red: 52 goals
Team Blue: 48 goals
Team Green: 61 goals
Team Yellow: 45 goals
Team Orange: 54 goals

What is the range of goals scored?
solution:
• The range is calculated by subtracting the lowest value from the highest value
• Highest number of goals: 61 (Team Green)
• Lowest number of goals: 45 (Team Yellow)
• Range = 61 - 45 = 16
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of goals scored is 16

question_text: A veterinary clinic recorded the weights (in kilograms) of 7 dogs that visited on Monday: 18, 25, 22, 18, 30, 26, 18. What is the range of these weights?
solution:
• The range is calculated by subtracting the smallest value from the largest value
• Largest weight = 30 kg
• Smallest weight = 18 kg
• Range = 30 - 18 = 12 kg
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of the weights is 12 kg

question_text:
A line graph shows the temperature (in °C) recorded at a weather station at different times during one day:

6am: 8°C
9am: 12°C
Noon: 18°C
3pm: 22°C
6pm: 16°C
9pm: 10°C

What is the range of temperatures recorded during this day?
solution:
• The range is calculated by subtracting the lowest value from the highest value
• The highest temperature recorded was 22°C (at 3pm)
• The lowest temperature recorded was 8°C (at 6am)
• Range = 22°C - 8°C = 14°C
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of temperatures is 14°C

question_text:
A pie chart shows how 240 students at a school choose their lunch options:
Sandwiches: 35%, Hot Meal: 40%, Salad: 15%, Packed Lunch: 10%

How many more students choose Hot Meal than Salad?
solution:
• First, calculate how many students choose Hot Meal: 40% of 240 = 0.40 × 240 = 96 students
• Next, calculate how many students choose Salad: 15% of 240 = 0.15 × 240 = 36 students
• Find the difference: 96 - 36 = 60 students
• Therefore, the answer is B because 60 more students choose Hot Meal than Salad

question_text:
A marine aquarium tracks the feeding schedule for different sea creatures. The table shows the daily food requirements:

| Creature | Base Amount (grams) | Per kg of Body Weight (grams) |
|----------|---------------------|-------------------------------|
| Seahorse | 2 | 0.5 |
| Starfish | 3 | 1 |
| Small octopus | 5 | 2 |
| Jellyfish | 1 | 0.25 |

The aquarium has a 3 kg small octopus and a 8 kg starfish. If food costs $0.20 per gram, what is the total daily cost to feed both creatures?
solution:
• Small octopus: 5 + (2 × 3) = 5 + 6 = 11 grams per day
• Starfish: 3 + (1 × 8) = 3 + 8 = 11 grams per day
• Total food needed: 11 + 11 = 22 grams per day
• Total cost: 22 × $0.20 = $4.40
• Therefore, the answer is B because the combined daily feeding cost is $4.40

question_text:
A museum recorded the number of visitors each day over a 6-day period:

Monday: 145 visitors
Tuesday: 162 visitors
Wednesday: 138 visitors
Thursday: 155 visitors
Friday: 180 visitors
Saturday: 166 visitors

What is the range of the number of visitors?
solution:
• Range = highest value − lowest value
• Highest number of visitors = 180 (Saturday)
• Lowest number of visitors = 138 (Wednesday)
• Range = 180 − 138 = 42
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is 42 visitors

question_text:
A telescope observatory tracks the number of celestial objects visible each night. The table shows the observation data for one week:

| Night | Stars | Planets | Satellites |
|-------|-------|---------|------------|
| Mon   | 45    | 3       | 2          |
| Tue   | 52    | 4       | 1          |
| Wed   | 38    | 2       | 3          |
| Thu   | 49    | 3       | 2          |
| Fri   | 41    | 4       | 1          |

How many stars were observed on Tuesday?
solution:
• Look at the row for Tuesday (Tue)
• Find the Stars column
• The value shown is 52
• Therefore, the answer is B because 52 stars were observed on Tuesday

question_text:
A weather station recorded the rainfall (in millimetres) over 6 consecutive days:

Day 1: 12 mm, Day 2: 8 mm, Day 3: 15 mm, Day 4: 10 mm, Day 5: 13 mm, Day 6: 8 mm

What is the median rainfall for these 6 days?
solution:
• To find the median, first arrange the values in order from smallest to largest: 8, 8, 10, 12, 13, 15
• Since there are 6 values (an even number), the median is the mean of the two middle values (3rd and 4th positions)
• The 3rd value is 10 mm and the 4th value is 12 mm
• Median = (10 + 12) ÷ 2 = 22 ÷ 2 = 11 mm
• Therefore, the answer is B because the median rainfall is 11 mm

question_text: A music teacher records the number of piano pieces practiced by three students over different weeks. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern: first number × 1, first number × 2, first number × 3
• Row 1: 3×1=3, 3×2=6, 3×3=9
• Row 2: 5×1=5, 5×2=10, 5×3=15
• Row 3: 10×1=10, 10×2=?, 10×3=30
• Therefore, the answer is B because 10×2=20

question_text: An astronomer records the number of meteor sightings during observation sessions. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern where the first number is multiplied by 2, 4, and 6 respectively
• Row 1: 3×2=6, 3×4=12, 3×6=18
• Row 2: 4×2=8, 4×4=16, 4×6=24
• Row 3: 5×2=10, 5×4=?, 5×6=30
• Therefore, the answer is B because 5×4=20

question_text: An archaeologist records the number of pottery fragments discovered at different excavation sites. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Look at each row: the third number equals the sum of the first two numbers, multiplied by 2
• Row 1: (8 + 4) × 2 = 12 × 2 = 24
• Row 2: (7 + 8) × 2 = 15 × 2 = 30
• Row 3: (9 + 9) × 2 = 18 × 2 = 36
• Therefore, the answer is B because 36 is the result of adding 9 + 9 and multiplying by 2

question_text: A toy store owner arranges building blocks on shelves. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows a pattern where the first number is multiplied by 1, 2, and 3
• Row 1: 3×1=3, 3×2=6, 3×3=9
• Row 2: 5×1=5, 5×2=10, 5×3=15
• Row 3: 6×1=6, 6×2=12, 6×3=18
• Therefore, the answer is B because 6×3=18

question_text: A game designer creates a puzzle with numbered tiles. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• The pattern works diagonally from top-left to bottom-right: each number is the product of its row number and column number, then multiplied by 6.
• Row 1, Column 1: 1×1×6 = 6
• Row 2, Column 2: 2×2×6 = 24
• Row 3, Column 3: 3×3×6 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is B because 3×3×6 = 54

question_text: A parallelogram-shaped bookmark has a base of 12 cm and a height of 5 cm. What is the area of the bookmark?
solution:
• The area of a parallelogram is calculated using the formula: Area = base × height
• Base = 12 cm and height = 5 cm
• Area = 12 × 5 = 60 cm²
• Therefore, the answer is B because the area of the parallelogram bookmark is 60 square centimetres

question_text: A rectangular swimming pool is surrounded by a uniform path that is 2 metres wide on all sides. The pool itself measures 12 metres by 8 metres. What is the area of the path only (not including the pool)?
solution:
• The pool dimensions are 12m × 8m, so pool area = 12 × 8 = 96 square metres
• The path is 2m wide on all sides, so the outer rectangle dimensions are (12 + 2 + 2) × (8 + 2 + 2) = 16m × 12m
• The total area including path = 16 × 12 = 192 square metres
• The area of the path only = Total area - Pool area = 192 - 96 = 104 square metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the path covers 104 square metres

question_text: A rectangular piece of paper measuring 24 cm by 18 cm has four identical squares cut from its corners. If each square has a side length of 3 cm, what is the perimeter of the remaining shape?
solution:
• Original rectangle has perimeter = 2(24 + 18) = 84 cm, but this changes when corners are cut
• When a square is cut from a corner, we remove 2 sides of length 3 cm from the perimeter, but add 2 new sides of length 3 cm
• Each corner cut removes sides totaling 6 cm and adds sides totaling 6 cm, creating an indentation
• The new perimeter = original perimeter + (additional perimeter from cuts) = 84 + 4(2 × 3) = 84 + 24 = 108 cm
• Alternatively: count all outer edges: top has 24 - 3 - 3 + 3 + 3 = 24 cm, similarly for all sides, plus the 8 new edges of 3 cm each = 24 + 24 + 18 + 18 + 24 = 108 cm
• Therefore, the answer is B because cutting corners adds extra edges that increase the total perimeter to 108 cm

answer_verification.reasoning: When squares are cut from corners, the outer edges of the rectangle remain unchanged (24 + 24 + 18 + 18 = 84 cm), but each cut creates two new internal edges of 3 cm each. With 4 corners cut, that's 4 × 2 × 3 = 24 cm of new perimeter added. Total: 84 + 24 = 108 cm. The solution correctly identifies that cutting corners doesn't remove perimeter but adds it through the indentations created. All other options are mathematically incorrect.

question_text: A rectangular postcard has a length of 15 cm and a width of 10 cm. What is the area of the postcard?
solution:
• Area of a rectangle = length × width
• Area = 15 cm × 10 cm = 150 square cm
• Therefore, the answer is B because the area is calculated by multiplying the length and width together.

question_text: A circular garden pond has a diameter of 12 metres. What is the radius of the pond?
solution:
• The radius of a circle is half the diameter
• Radius = Diameter ÷ 2
• Radius = 12 ÷ 2 = 6 metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the radius is 6 metres

question_text:
A table shows the number of pages read by 5 students during reading week:

Alex: 84 pages
Bella: 96 pages
Carlos: 72 pages
Diana: 88 pages
Ethan: 90 pages

What is the range of pages read?
solution:
• Range = highest value - lowest value
• Highest number of pages read = 96 (Bella)
• Lowest number of pages read = 72 (Carlos)
• Range = 96 - 72 = 24
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of pages read is 24

question_text: A triangular sail on a boat has a base of 6 metres and a height of 4 metres. What is the area of the sail?
solution:
• The formula for the area of a triangle is: Area = ½ × base × height
• Substituting the values: Area = ½ × 6 × 4
• Area = ½ × 24 = 12 square metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the area of the triangular sail is 12 square metres

question_text:
A library recorded the number of books borrowed each day over a 5-day period:

Monday: 68 books
Tuesday: 72 books
Wednesday: 58 books
Thursday: 82 books
Friday: 75 books

What is the range of books borrowed during this period?
solution:
• The range is calculated by subtracting the smallest value from the largest value
• Largest value: 82 books (Thursday)
• Smallest value: 58 books (Wednesday)
• Range = 82 - 58 = 24
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of books borrowed is 24

question_text:
A table shows the number of emails received by an office worker each day for one week:

Monday: 23 emails
Tuesday: 31 emails
Wednesday: 27 emails
Thursday: 19 emails
Friday: 35 emails

What is the mean number of emails received per day?
solution:
• To find the mean, add all values and divide by the number of days
• Total emails = 23 + 31 + 27 + 19 + 35 = 135
• Number of days = 5
• Mean = 135 ÷ 5 = 27
• Therefore, the answer is B because the mean number of emails received per day is 27

question_text:
A bakery recorded the number of loaves of bread sold each day for 6 days:

Monday: 85 loaves
Tuesday: 92 loaves
Wednesday: 78 loaves
Thursday: 95 loaves
Friday: 88 loaves
Saturday: 106 loaves

What is the range of loaves sold during this period?
solution:
• Range = highest value − lowest value
• Highest number of loaves sold = 106 (Saturday)
• Lowest number of loaves sold = 78 (Wednesday)
• Range = 106 − 78 = 28
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is 28 loaves

question_text:
A table shows the number of bronze, silver, and gold medals won by five countries at a sports championship:

Country A: 8 gold, 12 silver, 15 bronze
Country B: 15 gold, 10 silver, 8 bronze
Country C: 6 gold, 14 silver, 18 bronze
Country D: 12 gold, 9 silver, 11 bronze
Country E: 9 gold, 15 silver, 13 bronze

What is the range of the total number of medals won by these countries?
solution:
• First, calculate the total medals for each country:
• Country A: 8 + 12 + 15 = 35 medals
• Country B: 15 + 10 + 8 = 33 medals
• Country C: 6 + 14 + 18 = 38 medals
• Country D: 12 + 9 + 11 = 32 medals
• Country E: 9 + 15 + 13 = 37 medals
• Range = highest value - lowest value = 38 - 32 = 6
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of total medals is 6

question_text:
A bar graph shows the number of points scored by six basketball players in a tournament:

Player 1: 24 points
Player 2: 36 points
Player 3: 18 points
Player 4: 30 points
Player 5: 42 points
Player 6: 30 points

What is the range of points scored?
solution:
• The range is calculated by subtracting the lowest value from the highest value
• Highest value: 42 points (Player 5)
• Lowest value: 18 points (Player 3)
• Range = 42 - 18 = 24
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of points scored is 24

question_text:
A table shows the number of different bird species observed at a nature reserve over 5 months:

January: 34 species
February: 41 species
March: 38 species
April: 45 species
May: 42 species

What is the range of bird species observed during this period?
solution:
• The range is calculated by subtracting the smallest value from the largest value
• Identify the highest number: 45 species (April)
• Identify the lowest number: 34 species (January)
• Range = 45 - 34 = 11
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of bird species observed is 11

question_text: A historical timeline displays events from 0 to 6 centuries. Event A occurred at 1 and 3/8 centuries, Event B at 3 and 5/6 centuries, and Event C at 4 and 1/2 centuries. What is the distance on the timeline from Event A to Event C, expressed in its simplest form?
solution:
• Distance from Event A to Event C = 4 and 1/2 - 1 and 3/8
• Convert to improper fractions: 4 and 1/2 = 9/2 and 1 and 3/8 = 11/8
• Find common denominator: 9/2 = 36/8 and 11/8 = 11/8
• Subtract: 36/8 - 11/8 = 25/8
• Convert back to mixed number: 25/8 = 3 and 1/8
• Therefore, the answer is B because the distance between Event A and Event C is 3 and 1/8 centuries

question_text: A chess club organizes tournaments with different numbers of players. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern where the first number is multiplied by 2, 4, and 6 to get the three values
• Row 1: 3×2=6, 3×4=12, 3×6=18
• Row 2: 4×2=8, 4×4=16, 4×6=24
• Row 3: 5×2=10, 5×4=?, 5×6=30
• Therefore, the answer is B because 5×4=20

• Row 2: 5×1=5, 5×2=10, 5×3=15

question_text: A marine biologist records the number of dolphin pods observed during three research expeditions. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Look at the pattern in each row: the third number equals the sum of the first two numbers multiplied by the first number.
• Row 1: (4 + 2) × 4 = 6 × 4 = 24
• Row 2: (5 + 3) × 5 = 8 × 5 = 40
• Row 3: (6 + 3) × 6 = 9 × 6 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is B because 54 is the result of applying the pattern (6 + 3) × 6.

question_text:
The table shows the temperature (°C) recorded at a weather station at different times during one day:

Time        | Temperature (°C)
6:00 AM     | 8
9:00 AM     | 14
12:00 PM    | 22
3:00 PM     | 26
6:00 PM     | 18
9:00 PM     | 12

What was the mean temperature increase per hour between 6:00 AM and 3:00 PM?
solution:
• Time period from 6:00 AM to 3:00 PM = 9 hours
• Temperature at 6:00 AM = 8°C
• Temperature at 3:00 PM = 26°C
• Total temperature increase = 26 - 8 = 18°C
• Mean increase per hour = 18 ÷ 9 = 2°C per hour
• Therefore, the answer is A because the temperature increased by an average of 2°C per hour during this period

question_text: A train conductor records the number of passengers boarding at three different stations during morning, afternoon, and evening shifts. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each column follows a pattern where the third number equals the sum of the first two numbers multiplied by 3.
• Column 1: (4 + 8) × 3 = 12 × 3 = 36
• Column 2: (6 + 7) × 3 = 13 × 3 = 39
• Column 3: (9 + 9) × 3 = 18 × 3 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is B because (9 + 9) × 3 = 54

question_text: A coach records the number of goals scored by three soccer teams during practice sessions. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern: first number × 2 = second number, first number × 4 = third number
• Row 1: 3 × 2 = 6, 3 × 4 = 12
• Row 2: 4 × 2 = 8, 4 × 4 = 16
• Row 3: 5 × 2 = 10, 5 × 4 = 20
• Therefore, the answer is B because 5 × 4 = 20

question_text:
The table shows the number of stamps collected by five friends:

Friend | Stamps
Jason  | 24
Keiko  | 36
Liam   | 18
Mia    | 30
Nina   | 27

How many stamps do Jason and Liam have together?
solution:
• Find Jason's stamps: 24
• Find Liam's stamps: 18
• Add them together: 24 + 18 = 42
• Therefore, the answer is B because Jason and Liam have 42 stamps in total.

question_text:
The table shows the number of medals won by different countries at a swimming competition:

Country    | Gold | Silver | Bronze
Australia  | 8    | 6      | 5
Japan      | 5    | 7      | 9
USA        | 10   | 4      | 6
Canada     | 3    | 8      | 4

Which country won the greatest total number of medals?
solution:
• Calculate total medals for each country:
• Australia: 8 + 6 + 5 = 19
• Japan: 5 + 7 + 9 = 21
• USA: 10 + 4 + 6 = 20
• Canada: 3 + 8 + 4 = 15
• Therefore, the answer is B because Japan won 21 medals, which is the greatest total

question_text: A rectangular garden bed is surrounded by a concrete path of uniform width. The garden bed measures 12 m by 8 m. If the total area of the garden bed and path combined is 165 m², what is the width of the path?
solution:
• Area of garden bed = 12 × 8 = 96 m²
• Let the width of the path be x metres
• The outer rectangle (garden + path) has dimensions (12 + 2x) by (8 + 2x)
• Total area = (12 + 2x)(8 + 2x) = 165
• Expanding: 96 + 24x + 16x + 4x² = 165
• Simplifying: 4x² + 40x + 96 = 165
• 4x² + 40x - 69 = 0
• Testing x = 1.5: 4(1.5)² + 40(1.5) - 69 = 4(2.25) + 60 - 69 = 9 + 60 - 69 = 0 ✓
• Checking: outer dimensions = 12 + 3 = 15 m and 8 + 3 = 11 m; Area = 15 × 11 = 165 m² ✓
• Therefore, the answer is B because the path width is 1.5 m

question_text: A regular octagon (8-sided polygon) is positioned with one edge horizontal at the bottom. If you rotate it 135 degrees counterclockwise around its center, how many edges will now be in a vertical position (perfectly upright or perfectly downward)?
solution:
• A regular octagon has 8 equal sides with interior angles of 135 degrees each
• The angle between adjacent edges is 360° ÷ 8 = 45 degrees
• Starting position: one edge is horizontal at the bottom, so edges are positioned at 0°, 45°, 90°, 135°, 180°, 225°, 270°, and 315° from horizontal
• Initially, edges at 90° and 270° are vertical (2 edges)
• After rotating 135° counterclockwise, each edge rotates by 135°
• New positions: 135°, 180°, 225°, 270°, 315°, 0° (360°), 45°, 90°
• Vertical edges occur at 90° and 270° angles
• After rotation, edges are now at 90° and 270° (2 edges are vertical)
• Therefore, the answer is B because 2 edges will be in a vertical position

The solution's final answer of 2 vertical edges is correct, though the explanation of which specific edges become vertical could be clearer. All other options (0, 3, 4, 8) are mathematically incorrect given the geometry of a regular octagon.

question_text:
A library recorded the number of children who attended story time sessions over 5 days:

Monday: 18 children
Tuesday: 25 children
Wednesday: 22 children
Thursday: 18 children
Friday: 27 children

On how many days did fewer than 20 children attend?
solution:
• Identify days with fewer than 20 children: Monday (18), Tuesday (25), Wednesday (22), Thursday (18), Friday (27)
• Count days where attendance < 20: Monday (18) and Thursday (18)
• Therefore, the answer is B because 2 days had fewer than 20 children attend.

question_text: A triangular sail on a yacht has a base of 6 metres and a height of 8 metres. What is the area of the sail?
solution:
• Area of a triangle = ½ × base × height
• Area = ½ × 6 × 8
• Area = ½ × 48 = 24 m²
• Therefore, the answer is B because the area of the triangular sail is 24 m²

question_text:
A table shows the number of books read by 7 students during the summer holidays:

Alex: 6 books, Ben: 9 books, Chloe: 5 books, Daniel: 11 books, Emma: 7 books, Finn: 9 books, Grace: 8 books

What is the median number of books read?
solution:
• To find the median, arrange the data in order from smallest to largest: 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 9, 11
• There are 7 values, so the median is the middle value (the 4th value)
• The 4th value in the ordered list is 8
• Therefore, the answer is B because the median number of books read is 8

question_text:
The table shows the number of hours spent on different activities by students during a school camp:

Activity | Hours
Hiking | 8
Swimming | 5
Crafts | 6
Sports | 9
Campfire | 4

If the total time available was 40 hours and the remaining time was spent on meals and rest, what percentage of the total time was spent on meals and rest?
solution:
• First, calculate total hours spent on listed activities: 8 + 5 + 6 + 9 + 4 = 32 hours
• Time spent on meals and rest: 40 - 32 = 8 hours
• Calculate percentage: (8 ÷ 40) × 100 = 20%
• Therefore, the answer is B because 20% of the total time was spent on meals and rest

question_text:
The table shows the number of trees planted by different community groups during an environmental project:

Group        | Trees Planted
Green Team   | 84
Eco Warriors | 96
Nature Club  | 72
Tree Lovers  | 108

The groups decided to redistribute the trees so that each group plants an equal number. After redistribution, how many more trees will the Nature Club need to plant compared to what they originally had?
solution:
• Total trees planted = 84 + 96 + 72 + 108 = 360
• Equal distribution per group = 360 ÷ 4 = 90 trees
• Nature Club originally had 72 trees
• Additional trees needed = 90 - 72 = 18
• Therefore, the answer is B because Nature Club needs to plant 18 more trees to reach the equal distribution of 90 trees

question_text: A circular pizza has a diameter of 28 cm. What is the circumference of the pizza? (Use π = 22/7)
solution:
• Diameter = 28 cm
• Circumference = π × diameter
• Circumference = 22/7 × 28 = 22 × 4 = 88 cm
• Therefore, the answer is B because the circumference of the pizza is 88 cm.

question_text:
A line graph shows the number of customers who visited a bakery each day over one week:

Monday: 85, Tuesday: 92, Wednesday: 78, Thursday: 92, Friday: 105, Saturday: 92, Sunday: 70

The bakery owner wants to know the mode of the daily customer numbers. What is the mode?
solution:
• The mode is the value that appears most frequently in a data set
• Count the frequency of each value: 85 (once), 92 (three times), 78 (once), 105 (once), 70 (once)
• The value 92 appears 3 times, which is more frequent than any other value
• Therefore, the answer is B because 92 is the mode (appears on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday)

question_text: A library's digital catalog shows book downloads on a progress scale from 0 to 1 representing the complete collection. Fiction books represent 5/12 of the collection, and Non-fiction books end at 11/12 of the collection. If Non-fiction books start immediately after Fiction books end, what fraction of the collection do Non-fiction books represent?
solution:
• Fiction books end at 5/12 of the collection
• Non-fiction books end at 11/12 of the collection
• Non-fiction books start at 5/12 (immediately after Fiction)
• Fraction for Non-fiction = 11/12 - 5/12 = 6/12
• Simplify: 6/12 = 1/2
• Therefore, the answer is B because Non-fiction books represent 1/2 of the collection

question_text: A rectangular garden bed is divided into two equal sections by a fence running parallel to its width. If the garden bed has a length of 18 metres and a width of 8 metres, what is the perimeter of one section?
solution:
• The fence divides the garden parallel to the width, creating two sections each with length 9 metres (18 ÷ 2) and width 8 metres
• Perimeter of one section = 2 × (length + width) = 2 × (9 + 8) = 2 × 17 = 34 metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because each section has a perimeter of 34 metres

question_text: A clock tower shows 3:00. The minute hand and hour hand form an angle. What is the measure of the smaller angle between the two hands?
solution:
• At 3:00, the minute hand points at 12 and the hour hand points at 3
• The clock face is divided into 12 equal sections, each representing 30° (360° ÷ 12 = 30°)
• From 12 to 3, there are 3 sections: 3 × 30° = 90°
• Therefore, the answer is B because the smaller angle between the hands at 3:00 is 90°

question_text:
A wildlife sanctuary recorded the number of koalas spotted during 5 weeks of observation:

Week 1: 8 koalas
Week 2: 14 koalas
Week 3: 11 koalas
Week 4: 17 koalas
Week 5: 10 koalas

What is the range of the number of koalas spotted?
solution:
• The range is calculated by subtracting the smallest value from the largest value
• Largest value = 17 koalas (Week 4)
• Smallest value = 8 koalas (Week 1)
• Range = 17 - 8 = 9
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of koalas spotted is 9

question_text: A weather station records rainfall on a measuring gauge from 0 to 1 centimetre. At 9am, the gauge shows 1/6 cm of rain has fallen. What reading does the gauge show?
solution:
• The question asks what reading the gauge shows at 9am
• The gauge shows 1/6 cm of rain has fallen
• We simply read the value directly from the number line position
• Therefore, the answer is A because the gauge shows 1/6 cm

question_text: A chocolate bar is divided into sections on a wrapper marked from 0 to 1 representing the whole bar. Emma eats up to the 2/9 mark, and then eats another portion up to the 5/9 mark. What fraction of the chocolate bar did Emma eat in her second portion?
solution:
• Emma's first portion ends at 2/9
• Emma's second portion ends at 5/9
• The second portion = 5/9 - 2/9 = 3/9
• Simplifying: 3/9 = 1/3
• Therefore, the answer is B because Emma ate 1/3 of the chocolate bar in her second portion

question_text: A rectangular tablet screen has a length of 24 cm and a width of 18 cm. A software update adds a uniform border around the screen that is 3 cm wide on all sides. What is the area of the border only?
solution:
• Original screen dimensions: 24 cm × 18 cm, with area = 24 × 18 = 432 cm²
• With border, new dimensions: length = 24 + 3 + 3 = 30 cm, width = 18 + 3 + 3 = 24 cm
• Total area with border = 30 × 24 = 720 cm²
• Area of border only = 720 - 432 = 288 cm²
• Therefore, the answer is B because the border area is found by subtracting the original screen area from the total area including the border

question_text: A rectangular flag has a diagonal that measures 25 cm. If the length of the flag is 20 cm, what is the width of the flag?
solution:
• Using the Pythagorean theorem for a rectangle: diagonal² = length² + width²
• Substituting the known values: 25² = 20² + width²
• Calculating: 625 = 400 + width²
• Therefore: width² = 625 - 400 = 225
• Taking the square root: width = 15 cm
• Therefore, the answer is B because the width of the flag is 15 cm

question_text:
A table shows the number of hours 6 friends spent practicing musical instruments during one week:

Sarah: 5 hours
Tom: 8 hours
Lily: 6 hours
Jack: 9 hours
Mia: 5 hours
Oliver: 7 hours

What is the median number of hours practiced?
solution:
• To find the median, first arrange the values in order from smallest to largest: 5, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9
• Since there are 6 values (an even number), the median is the average of the two middle values
• The two middle values are 6 and 7
• Median = (6 + 7) ÷ 2 = 13 ÷ 2 = 6.5
• Therefore, the answer is B because the median number of hours practiced is 6.5

question_text:
A table shows the number of messages sent by 7 students in a group chat during one week:

Liam: 24 messages
Olivia: 18 messages
Noah: 32 messages
Emma: 18 messages
James: 26 messages
Sophia: 18 messages
Ava: 20 messages

What is the range of messages sent?
solution:
• Range = highest value − lowest value
• Highest number of messages = 32 (Noah)
• Lowest number of messages = 18 (Olivia, Emma, and Sophia)
• Range = 32 − 18 = 14
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is 14 messages

question_text: A weather station records the number of rainy days in three different months. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern where the first number is multiplied by 2, 3, and 4 to get the three values
• Row 1: 3×2=6, 3×3=9, 3×4=12
• Row 2: 4×2=8, 4×3=12, 4×4=16
• Row 3: 5×2=10, 5×3=15, 5×4=20
• Therefore, the answer is B because 5×4=20

question_text: A bar graph shows the number of goals scored by a soccer team in their last 8 matches: 3, 1, 4, 2, 3, 5, 3, 1. The team's coach wants to know the range of goals scored. What is the range?
solution:
• The range is calculated as the difference between the highest and lowest values in the data set
• Highest number of goals = 5
• Lowest number of goals = 1
• Range = 5 - 1 = 4
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of goals scored is 4

question_text: A music teacher records the number of instruments practiced by students in three different classes. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern where the first number is multiplied by 1, 2, and 3
• Row 1: 8×1=8, 8×2=16, 8×3=24
• Row 2: 10×1=10, 10×2=20, 10×3=30
• Row 3: 9×1=9, 9×2=18, 9×3=27
• Therefore, the answer is B because 9×3=27

question_text: A histogram shows the number of trees planted by a conservation group over 7 weeks: 16, 23, 19, 16, 28, 21, 16. What is the range of trees planted?
solution:
• To find the range, identify the highest and lowest values in the data set
• Highest value: 28 trees (Week 5)
• Lowest value: 16 trees (Weeks 1, 4, and 7)
• Range = Highest value - Lowest value = 28 - 16 = 12
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range of trees planted is 12

question_text: A zookeeper records the number of fish fed to penguins during different feeding times. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern: first number × 1, first number × 2, first number × 3
• Row 1: 3×1=3, 3×2=6, 3×3=9
• Row 2: 5×1=5, 5×2=10, 5×3=15
• Row 3: 6×1=6, 6×2=12, 6×3=18
• Therefore, the answer is B because 6×3=18

question_text: A pet shop recorded the number of fish sold each day over 8 days: 15, 22, 18, 22, 30, 22, 25, 18. What is the range of fish sold during this period?
solution:
• Range = highest value − lowest value
• Highest number of fish sold = 30
• Lowest number of fish sold = 15
• Range = 30 − 15 = 15
• Therefore, the answer is B because the range is 15

question_text:
A museum recorded the number of visitors each day over one week:

Monday: 156 visitors
Tuesday: 142 visitors
Wednesday: 168 visitors
Thursday: 142 visitors
Friday: 185 visitors
Saturday: 201 visitors
Sunday: 178 visitors

What is the mean number of visitors per day?
solution:
• To find the mean, add all values: 156 + 142 + 168 + 142 + 185 + 201 + 178 = 1172
• Divide by the number of days: 1172 ÷ 7 = 167.43...
• Round to nearest whole number: 168
• Therefore, the answer is A because the mean number of visitors per day is 168

question_text: A botanist measures the growth of three different plant species over several weeks. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row shows a plant's growth multiplied by 1, 2, and 3
• Row 1: 8×1=8, 8×2=16, 8×3=24
• Row 2: 10×1=10, 10×2=20, 10×3=30
• Row 3: 9×1=9, 9×2=18, 9×3=27
• Therefore, the answer is B because 9×3=27

question_text: An astronomer records the number of meteor sightings during three observation nights. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• The pattern works across each row: multiply the first number by the second number, then add the first number
• Row 1: (4 × 5) + 4 = 20 + 4 = 24
• Row 2: (6 × 7) + 6 = 42 + 6 = 48
• Row 3: (9 × 5) + 9 = 45 + 9 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is B because 54 is the result of applying the pattern (9 × 5) + 9

question_text: An archaeologist discovers ancient tiles with numbers carved on them. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Look at each row: the third number equals the first number multiplied by the second number, then add the first number again.
• Row 1: (4 × 3) + 4 = 12 + 4 = 16
• Row 2: (6 × 2) + 6 = 12 + 6 = 18
• Row 3: (8 × 3) + 8 = 24 + 8 = 32
• Therefore, the answer is B because 32 follows the pattern of (first × second) + first

question_text: A cycling team tracks the number of kilometers ridden by three cyclists during training sessions. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row shows a cyclist's distance pattern: the first number multiplied by 1, 2, and 3
• Row 1: 8×1=8, 8×2=16, 8×3=24
• Row 2: 10×1=10, 10×2=20, 10×3=30
• Row 3: 9×1=9, 9×2=?, 9×3=27
• Therefore, the answer is B because 9×2=18, but the missing value is in the third position: 9×3=27

question_text: A jeweler arranges gemstones in display cases. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Each row follows the pattern where the first number is multiplied by 2, 4, and 6 to get the three values.
• Row 1: 3×2=6, 3×4=12, 3×6=18
• Row 2: 4×2=8, 4×4=16, 4×6=24
• Row 3: 5×2=10, 5×4=?, 5×6=30
• Therefore, the answer is B because 5×4=20

question_text: A video game designer creates a puzzle with number tiles. Study the pattern in the grid below. What number should replace the question mark?
solution:
• Look at each row: the third number equals the sum of the first two numbers multiplied by the first number.
• Row 1: (4 + 2) × 4 = 6 × 4 = 24
• Row 2: (5 + 3) × 5 = 8 × 5 = 40
• Row 3: (6 + 3) × 6 = 9 × 6 = 54
• Therefore, the answer is B because the pattern is (first + second) × first = third, giving us 54.

question_text:
A table shows the ages of volunteers at a community festival:

Volunteer A: 14 years
Volunteer B: 11 years
Volunteer C: 16 years
Volunteer D: 13 years
Volunteer E: 11 years
Volunteer F: 19 years
Volunteer G: 15 years

What is the difference between the median age and the mode age?
solution:
• First, arrange the ages in order: 11, 11, 13, 14, 15, 16, 19
• The median is the middle value (4th out of 7 numbers) = 14 years
• The mode is the most frequent value = 11 years (appears twice)
• The difference = 14 - 11 = 3 years
• Therefore, the answer is B because the median (14) minus the mode (11) equals 3 years

question_text: A triangular park has angles measuring 65° and 48°. What is the measure of the third angle?
solution:
• The sum of all angles in any triangle is 180°
• The two known angles are 65° and 48°
• Third angle = 180° - 65° - 48° = 180° - 113° = 67°
• Therefore, the answer is B because the third angle must be 67° to make the total 180°

question_text: A parallelogram-shaped billboard has a base of 18 metres and a perpendicular height of 8 metres. What is the area of the billboard?
solution:
• The area of a parallelogram is calculated using the formula: Area = base × height
• Given: base = 18 metres, height = 8 metres
• Area = 18 × 8 = 144 square metres
• Therefore, the answer is B because the area of the parallelogram-shaped billboard is 144 m²

question_text: A trapezium-shaped poster has parallel sides of 18 cm and 12 cm, and a perpendicular height of 10 cm. What is the area of the poster?
solution:
• Area of trapezium = ½ × (sum of parallel sides) × height
• Area = ½ × (18 + 12) × 10
• Area = ½ × 30 × 10 = 15 × 10 = 150 cm²
• Therefore, the answer is B because the area of the trapezium-shaped poster is 150 cm²

question_text:
A table shows the number of emails received by a small business each day over one week:

Monday: 45 emails
Tuesday: 52 emails
Wednesday: 38 emails
Thursday: 45 emails
Friday: 61 emails
Saturday: 29 emails
Sunday: 34 emails

What is the median number of emails received per day?
solution:
• To find the median, first arrange the values in order from smallest to largest: 29, 34, 38, 45, 45, 52, 61
• There are 7 values, so the median is the middle value (the 4th value)
• The 4th value in the ordered list is 45
• Therefore, the answer is B because the median number of emails received per day is 45

question_text:
The table shows the number of points earned by five teams in a robotics competition across three rounds:

Team    | Round 1 | Round 2 | Round 3
Alpha   | 85      | 92      | 78
Beta    | 76      | 88      | 95
Gamma   | 90      | 85      | 82
Delta   | 82      | 79      | 91
Epsilon | 88      | 90      | 84

Which team had the greatest improvement from their lowest round score to their highest round score?
solution:
• Calculate the range (highest - lowest) for each team:
• Alpha: 92 - 78 = 14
• Beta: 95 - 76 = 19
• Gamma: 90 - 82 = 8
• Delta: 91 - 79 = 12
• Epsilon: 90 - 84 = 6
• Therefore, the answer is B because Beta had the greatest improvement of 19 points (from 76 to 95).

question_text:
The table shows the number of different types of birds observed at a wildlife sanctuary over a weekend:

Bird Type | Saturday | Sunday
Parrots   | 28       | 35
Cockatoos | 42       | 38
Kookaburras| 15      | 22
Rosellas  | 31       | 27

On which day were more birds observed in total, and by how many?
answer_options: E) Both days had the same total
solution:
• Calculate Saturday total: 28 + 42 + 15 + 31 = 116 birds
• Calculate Sunday total: 35 + 38 + 22 + 27 = 122 birds
• Find the difference: 122 - 116 = 6 birds
• Therefore, the answer is B because Sunday had 6 more birds observed than Saturday

question_text:
The table shows the number of different types of vehicles that passed through a toll booth during peak and off-peak hours:

Vehicle Type | Peak Hours | Off-Peak Hours
Cars         | 240        | 180
Trucks       | 45         | 30
Motorcycles  | 60         | 45
Buses        | 15         | 10

What percentage of the total vehicles during peak hours were either trucks or buses?
solution:
• First, calculate total vehicles during peak hours: 240 + 45 + 60 + 15 = 360 vehicles
• Then, find the number of trucks and buses during peak hours: 45 + 15 = 60 vehicles
• Calculate the percentage: (60 ÷ 360) × 100 = 16.666...% = 16.7%
• Therefore, the answer is B because trucks and buses together represent 16.7% of all peak hour vehicles

question_text: A rectangular book is lying flat on a desk with its front cover facing up. The title is printed at the top of the cover. If you flip the book 180 degrees around its horizontal axis (like turning a page forward over the top edge), where will the title appear?
answer_options: A) At the top, facing up and readable
B) At the bottom, facing up but upside-down
C) At the top, facing down against the desk
D) At the bottom, facing down against the desk
E) In the same position as before
solution:
• Initially, the title is at the top of the front cover, which is facing up
• Flipping 180 degrees around the horizontal axis means rotating the book forward over its top edge
• After this flip, the front cover is now facing down against the desk
• The title, which was at the top, is now at the bottom of the book (the edge that was at top is now at bottom)
• Therefore, the answer is D because the title is at the bottom and facing down against the desk

visual_data.description: Two side-view diagrams showing: (1) Initial state - book lying flat with front cover up, arrow pointing to title at top edge; (2) After flip - book after 180-degree rotation around horizontal axis, showing front cover now facing down with title at bottom edge
